tit.e: Goi no Kurodo (Chamberlain of Fifth Rank)
Goi no Kurodo (Chamberlain of Fifth Rank)
Goi no Kurodo (Chamberlain of Fifth Rank)

sen.j: 五位蔵人（ごいのくろうど）は、律令制下の日本における官職（令外官）の一つ。
sen.e: Goi no Kurodo was a post of Ryoge no kan (class outside of the Ritsuryo system) under the Japanese Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo codes).
Goi no Kurodo was a post of Ryoge no kan (class outside of the Ritsuryo system) under the Japanese Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
sen.cmt: changed "codes" to "code" to fit the word list;
sen.e: Goi no Kurodo was a post of Ryoge no kan (class outside of the Ritsuryo system) under the Japanese Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 蔵人所の次官で、蔵人頭の次位にあたる。
sen.e: This post corresponded to Suke (assistant director) at Kurododokoro (the Chamberlain's Office), and this rank was placed immediately under Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain).
This post was equivalent to a Suke (assistant director) at the Kurododokoro (Chamberlain's Office) and was placed immediately under the Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain).
sen.cmt: changed "corresponded" to "equivalent" for clarity;
sen.e: This post was equivalent to a Suke (assistant director) at the Kurododokoro (Chamberlain's Office) and was placed immediately under the Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 定員は2~3名で、五位の殿上人の中から、家柄がよく学識才能のある者が特に選ばれた。
sen.e: Up to two to three persons were appointed to this post, selected from Tenjobito (a high-ranking courtier allowed into the Imperial Palace) with the Fifth Rank, especially those who came of a good family having knowledge and talent.

Up to two to three personnel could be appointed to this post, and they were selected from among the Tenjobito (a high-ranking courtier allowed into the Imperial Palace) of the Fifth Rank, with particular favor for individuals from families of nobility and who were scholarly gifted.
sen.cmt: "good family"→"families of nobility"；"knowledge and talent"→"scholarly gifted"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Up to two to three personnel could be appointed to this post, and they were selected from among the Tenjobito (a high-ranking courtier allowed into the Imperial Palace) of the Fifth Rank, with particular favor for individuals from families of nobility and who were scholarly gifted.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 五位蔵人という言葉が歴史上に出てくるのは、『職事補任』宇多院の項の分注に「仁和四年十一月廿七日、始置五位蔵人二人、止六位二人」とある。
sen.e: The term "Goi no Kurodo" appeared for the first time in the explanatory notes for the section of Udain in "Shikijibunin" saying, "On January 6, 889, two persons were appointed to Goi no Kurodo, and another two persons were subsequently appointed to Rokui no Kurodo."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 日付はグレゴリオ歴に直してあります
sen.e: The term "Goi no Kurodo" first appeared in the notes on Udain in the "Shikijibunin," which explained, "On January 6, 889, two persons were appointed to Goi no Kurodo, and another two persons were subsequently appointed to Rokui no Kurodo."
sen.cmt: eliminated "explanatory" and "section" to tone down the wordiness
sen.e: The term "Goi no Kurodo" first appeared in the notes on Udain in the "Shikijibunin" (directory of officials) which explained, 'On January 6, 889, two persons were appointed to Goi no Kurodo, and another two persons were subsequently appointed to Rokui no Kurodo.'
sen.cmt: 補足しました。

sen.j: 源湛・藤原敏行の2名が五位蔵人に補任されたのが初見で、これ以後頻出している。
sen.e: Two persons named MINAMOTO no Tatau and FUJIWARA no Toshiyuki were the first ones to be appointed as Goi no Kurodo, and the term appeared frequently thereafter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The first two persons to be appointed as Goi no Kurodo were named MINAMOTO no Tatsu and FUJIWARA no Toshiyuki, after which the term appeared frequently.
sen.cmt: fixed word order to sound more natural
sen.e: The first two persons to be appointed as Goi no Kurodo were named MINAMOTO no Tatsu and FUJIWARA no Toshiyuki, after which the term appeared frequently.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これ以前にも五位蔵人は存在していたが、無位の蔵人もあり、蔵人8人の位階は必ずしも一定しなかった。
sen.e: Before that, the post of Goi no Kurodo was already present, and there was also the post of Mui no Kurodo (Chamberlain of No Rank), so official ranks of eight persons appointed to Kurodo were not always fixed.

The post of Goi no Kurodo had existed beforehand as well, but there was also the post of Mui no Kurodo (Chamberlain with No Rank), meaning that the official ranks for eight positions of Kurodo were not always standardized.
sen.cmt: "fixed"→"standardized"; changed word order for better clarity
sen.e: The post of Goi no Kurodo had existed beforehand as well, but there was also the post of Mui no Kurodo (Chamberlain with No Rank), meaning that the official ranks for eight positions of Kurodo were not always standardized.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 当時は五位と六位の間に身分上明確な一線が引かれ、官人の行動や儀制面で大きな差があったため、蔵人を一括することが困難であった。
sen.e: At that time, a clear distinction was made between Fifth-rank and Sixth-rank personnel in social status; big differences lay between them regarding official activities or ceremony and system, so it was difficult to put them together as Kurodo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: During that time, it was difficult to classify every official as a Kurodo because there was a clear distinction between the Fifth and Sixth ranks in terms of social status, as well as considerable differences between their social activities and custom rituals.
sen.cmt: It was difficult to keep this as one sentence, but I changed the order to make it flow naturally
sen.e: During that time, it was difficult to classify every official as a Kurodo because there was a clear distinction between the Fifth and Sixth ranks in terms of social status, as well as considerable differences between their social activities and custom rituals.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 蔵人所の職掌も次第に分化し、身分の高低が密接に関係するようになった。
sen.e: As the specialization in official duties of Kurododokoro gradually increased, social status became closely related to official posts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As official duties of the Kurododokoro were gradually specialized, social status became closely related to who was posted where.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: As official duties of the Kurododokoro were gradually specialized, social status became closely related to who was posted where.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: このことが五位蔵人の設置と、それに伴う機構の整備を生んだ理由と考えられる。
sen.e: This probably led to the establishment of the post of Goi no Kurodo and the improvement of correspoding system.
It is believed that this lead to the establishment of the Goi no Kurodo post and the reason behind the improvements to the corresponding organizational infrastructure.
sen.cmt: reworded the sentence for better clarity
sen.e: It is believed that this lead to the establishment of the Goi no Kurodo post and the reason behind the improvements to the corresponding organizational infrastructure.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これ以後、五位蔵人が四位に、六位蔵人が五位に昇進した場合が、新しい位階のまま蔵人に留まることは許されず、位階と蔵人の職が不可分のものとなり、五位蔵人及び六位蔵人は官職名とみなされるようになった。
sen.e: Later, when a person of Goi no Kurodo was promoted to the Fourth Rank, or when a person of Rokui no Kurodo (Chamberlain of Sixth Rank) was promoted to the Fifth Rank, the person was not allowed to remain as Kurodo with his new rank; the court rank and the post of Kurodo became inseparable, so the posts of Goi no Kurodo and Rokui no Kurodo were regarded as the names of official posts.

From that point on, when a person holding the post of Goi no Kurodo was promoted to the Fourth Rank, or when a person holding the post of Rokui no Kurodo (Chamberlain of Sixth Rank) was promoted to the Fifth Rank, rather than being allowed to remain as Kurodo with a new rank, their court rank and Kurodo posts became inseparable and the posts of Goi no Kurodo and Rokui no Kurodo were regarded as the names of official posts.
sen.cmt: 許されず→"rather than being allowed"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: From that point on, when a person holding the post of Goi no Kurodo was promoted to the Fourth Rank, or when a person holding the post of Rokui no Kurodo (Chamberlain of Sixth Rank) was promoted to the Fifth Rank, rather than being allowed to remain as Kurodo with a new rank, their court rank and Kurodo posts became inseparable and the posts of Goi no Kurodo and Rokui no Kurodo were regarded as the names of official posts.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
